talk1014:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:LaughS_00>Hylians cook their food, right? How funny!
Seems tedious, but I bet it has its charms.

If you get hungry or find yourself low on
energy, feel free to use that pot!
talk9008:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_01>My beloved Kayden...<sp:5:0:0> He says he's going
to teach Sasan to climb waterfalls, even
though he's a Hylian.
So reckless!<sp:5:0:0> But he's really going out of
his way to be nice.<sp:5:0:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Ease>Sasan should honestly refuse his offer,
but that's just not in his character.<sp:5:0:0>
He's such a nice young man.
talk1015:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Chat_00>Oh! I know! You should stay here!
You will, won't you?

<sp:3:0:2:0801>As you can see, you're our only customer,
so you've got the whole place to yourself.
Try the water bed if you like...it's divine!
talk9009:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Think_00>Kayden has been insisting he's going
to teach Sasan to climb waterfalls. Hm.

Hylians climbing waterfalls...<sp:5:1:0> Why not!
I'm sure he will enjoy the challenge.<sp:5:1:0>
Still, I am a tad worried.
talk1016:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_00>If you intend to stay here, I highly
recommend the water bed!

It was made to order especially for
Hylians, so I'm confident you'll sleep
really well on it, Linny!
talk9010:
<sp:3:0:2:0401><snd:TalkPositive_00>Sasan says he had to overcome a
mountain of sludge to get here.<sp:5:0:0>

He's such a delicate little Hylian, unlike
a certain other someone, <sp:5:0:0>so that's quite
a feat!
talk1017:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Think_01>Finley has been waiting for Sasan for
so long, even at this late hour.

I've expressed how scared I would be if
she strayed too far from the domain, but
the choice is hers. I'm very worried.
talk9011:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Chat_01>Sasan says he had to contend with a
mountain of sludge to get here.<sp:5:1:0> Perhaps
his training is paying off after all?
talk1018:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Ease_00>I believe Finley used to help Sasan when
he cooked food here.

If only that kind of normalcy would return.<sp:5:0:0>
I would be so overjoyed.
talk9012:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_01>Hey, Linny!<sp:5:1:0> Listen up!


I found a suuuper-old story in an<clr:0000> ancient
manuscript <clr:ffff>while organizing the inn's
bookshelf with <clr:0000>Finley<clr:ffff>.
talk9019_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>Linny!<sp:5:1:0> Did you swing by to hear about
that ancient manuscript again?
talk1019:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Think>With the sludge falling outside, it's not
too safe to go out, and we also don't
have a lot of visitors these days.
That means I don't have a thing to do
other than organize the bookshelf...

<sp:3:0:2:0301>Still, there's no big rush, so I'll at least
go about it in a leisurely manner.
talk9021_01:
<snd:TalkPositive_00>Oh, I almost forgot!<sp:5:0:0> Listen up, Linny!<sp:5:0:0>
I have a fun story for the brave savior of
the domain.
It's a suuuper-old story from an <clr:0000>ancient
manuscript <clr:ffff>I found while organizing the
inn's bookshelf with <clr:0000>Finley<clr:ffff>.
talk9014:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>Here's the story from that ancient
manuscript...

"Long, long ago at <clr:0000>Tarm Point<clr:ffff>,
a blessed stone was hidden away
within a sacred <clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff>.
"It was a magnificent <clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff> that was
overflowing with blessings."
talk1021:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_01>Wow!<sp:5:0:0> You never stop with the surprises,
do you, Linny?

<sp:3:0:2:0801>It's amazing...<sp:5:1:0> The way you cleaned up
that sludge-covered statue so quickly?
Just, wow!
Speaking of, Lady Yona is standing in
front of that sparkling-clean statue. I'm
sure she's as grateful as the rest of us.
talk1022:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>I'm sure Lady Yona is grateful for your
help.<sp:5:1:0> Oh! By the way, <sp:5:0:0>that's her standing
in front of the statue.
talk1023:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>It's Linny!<sp:5:1:0> Oh, ahem, I mean... <sp:5:1:0>Hello, Link!


It's so incredible how you were able to
clean up that sludge-covered statue
so easily!
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>You really are amazing, Linn...<sp:5:1:0> Uh, Link.<sp:5:1:0>
You...<sp:5:1:0> Um...<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>Argh, enough already! <sp:5:0:0>I can't stand it!<sp:5:1:0>
It feels so cold and unnatural to call you
that, as though we're strangers!
I thought it would feel weirder to call
the hero of the domain by some silly
nickname I gave him as a child, but...
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Oh, whatever! I'm just going to go ahead
and call you Linny! Hey, Linny! Ahhh, yes.
That feels sooo much better.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I call you Linny because you're more than
just "Link" to me.<sp:5:1:0> I hope you'll forgive me
for using my "old friend" card for that.
Anyway, thanks for cleaning up that
statue, Linny! <sp:5:0:0>You really are the best.

<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_01>Speaking of, Lady Yona is standing in
front of that sparkling-clean statue. I'm
sure she's as grateful as the rest of us.
talk9017:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Think_00>Finley and Sasan went out treasure
hunting. They came back empty-handed.
And yet...
They seem so happy, you would
never have guessed they didn't find
the treasure!
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>They must have had a grand old time on
their adventure, even if they didn't find
what they were originally looking for.
talk9019:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting>Linny!<sp:5:1:0> Finley and Sasan still haven't
returned from their treasure-hunting
adventure.
talk9012_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Chat_01>Ah, that's it!<sp:5:1:0> The story about the sacred
<clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff> at <clr:0000>Tarm Point<clr:ffff>! Linny, that must
mean you ran into Sasan, right?
talk9020:
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>"Long, long ago at <clr:0000>Tarm Point<clr:ffff>,
a blessed stone was hidden away
within a sacred <clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff>.
"It was a magnificent <clr:0000>shrine<clr:ffff> that was
overflowing with blessings."

<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Chat_01>That's the story I found in an ancient
manuscript that was in the bookshelf.
I bet it was left behind by my ancestors.
<sp:3:0:2:0701>It says the shrine is sacred, so there must
be some truly amazing treasure there!
talk9021:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>Oh, Linny!<sp:5:1:0> I mean...Link!


You should've told me sooner that you
were visiting the domain! <sp:5:0:0>Really though!

Imagine how surprised I was to find out
you were here AFTER you had already
saved the domain again! It's just silly!
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Speaking of, I know it's a bit late to thank
you for your continued heroics, <sp:5:0:0>but thanks
so much, Linn...<sp:5:0:0> Uh, Link.<sp:5:1:0> You...<sp:5:1:0> Um...<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>Argh, enough already! I can't stand it!<sp:5:1:0>
It feels so cold and unnatural to call you
that, as though we're strangers!
I thought it would feel weirder to call
the hero of the domain by some silly
nickname I gave him as a child, but...
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:LaughS_01>Oh, whatever! I'm just going to go ahead
and call you Linny! Hey, Linny! Ahhh, yes.
That feels sooo much better.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>I call you Linny because you're more than
just "Link" to me. I hope you'll forgive me
for using my "old friend" card for that.
talk9012_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:LaughS_01>Oh, Linny! It's thanks to you that Finley
and Sasan were able to find each other!

I can't wait to ask them about it when
they return.<sp:5:1:0> Thanks for your help,<sp:5:0:0> Linny!
talk9023:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS>A beautiful memory is more priceless than
the most precious of jewels... Heh, or am
I being overly sappy here?
0002: That's a bit of a stretch.
talk1003:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>It's Linny!<sp:5:1:0> Oh, ahem, I mean... <sp:5:1:0>Hello,
Link! <sp:5:0:0>I'm impressed you were able to
make it to the domain!
The roads are muddied up with the
sludge, <sp:5:0:0>and the river is so dirty, we
can't even swim in it.
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:Think_00>You really are amazing, Linn...<sp:5:1:0> Uh, Link.<sp:5:1:0>
You...<sp:5:1:0> Um...<sp:5:1:0>

<sp:3:0:2:0901><snd:Angry_00>Argh, enough already! <sp:5:0:0>I can't stand it!<sp:5:1:0>
It feels so cold and unnatural to call you
that, as though we're strangers!
I thought it would feel weirder to call
the hero of the domain by some silly
nickname I gave him as a child, but...
<sp:3:0:2:0701><snd:TalkPositive_00>Oh, whatever! I'm just going to go ahead
and call you Linny! Ahhh, yes. That feels
sooo much better.
<sp:3:0:2:0101>You're more than just "Link" to me.<sp:5:1:0>
I hope you'll forgive me for using my
"old friend" card for that.
Anyway, you're amazing, Linny! Only you
could make it to the domain under these
conditions!<sp:5:0:0> I'm so happy to see you again!
talk9014_00_00:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughS_00>See!<sp:5:1:0> It's clearly an ancient manuscript
containing a timeless secret, right?
talk9014_00_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:Happy_00>Right?<sp:5:1:0> I knew of all people, an adventurer
like you would understand, Linny!
talk1005:

but the <clr:0000>Seabed Inn <clr:ffff>is still up and running.

<sp:3:0:2:0101>If you'd like to stay here, go ahead and
sign in at the counter in the back.
talk9014_00_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0b01><snd:SurpriseS_00>Huh?!<sp:5:1:0> Oh, come on! You can practically
FEEL the ancient mystery contained in
this manuscript. Admit it!

talk9020_01:
<snd:QuestionNormal_01>When she read that, my daughter, <clr:0000>Finley<clr:ffff>,
grabbed <clr:0000>Sasan <clr:ffff>and raced away from the
domain in search of treasure.
talk9000:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Greeting_00>You came! I'm so happy.


Our amazing water bed is waiting for you!


I crafted it myself, so in a way, sleeping
on it is like getting a nice, big hug from
me as you dream!
<sp:3:0:2:0801><snd:LaughL_01>Ha! <sp:5:0:0>Is that a strange thing to say?
Well, you get what I mean.

All joking aside, <sp:5:0:0>you're guaranteed a
peaceful rest in that bed.
talk1007:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>Are you hungry, Linny? Feel free to use
that pot as much as you like!

<sp:3:0:2:0101>A merchant boy who was staying here
used it regularly, until the recent
happenings.
Us Zora eat our fish raw, so we have no
need for it. That cooking area is just for
the convenience of customers.
talk9020_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>Finley is headstrong to say the least,<sp:5:0:0>
and Sasan is quite brave as well. I'm sure
they'll be just fine.
talk9001:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Greeting_00>Welcome!


Prepare to enjoy the most comfortable
night of your life with our luxurious
water bed!
talk1008:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_01>Us Zora <sp:5:0:0>sleep in the comforting embrace
of fresh water rather than beds.

<sp:3:0:2:0101>That is why we prepared a special water
bed at this inn, so that Hylians could also
enjoy a nice, watery rest.
<snd:LaughS_01>There's no sludge on it, of course, so you
can count on us for peaceful sleep on a
soft, clean bed.
talk9020_03:
<clr:0000><sp:3:0:2:0001>Tarm Point<clr:ffff> is pretty far to the southeast
of the domain, but they should have made
it there by now, wouldn't you think?
talk1009:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Ease_00>Poor Finley has been waiting for Sasan
for so long.

I remember being her age... I was just
like her.

<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>I'm incredibly proud of what a caring
young lady she's become.

Kayden and I stay so busy, as do her
friends. <sp:5:0:0>She was so lonely before he
came into her life.
I'm so grateful she and Sasan found
each other.
talk9014_01:
<sp:3:0:2:0c01>This is probably something left behind by
my great-great-great-great-grandpa...<sp:5:0:0>
Probably even more greats than that!
<sp:3:0:2:0001>It says the shrine is sacred, so there must
be some truly amazing treasure there!
talk9020_04:
<sp:3:0:2:0b00><snd:SurpriseS_00>Huh?!<sp:5:0:0> There's a cave at Tarm Point and
Finley swam inside of it all alone?

And now Sasan is trying to go in after her
on a raft?!

<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:LaughS_00>Hee-hee!<sp:5:1:0> I should have known it would
turn out like that.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>Poor Sasan is probably desperate to catch
up to Finley so they can find the treasure
together. I hope he makes it inside safely.
talk1010:
<sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Ease_00>As I recall, <sp:5:0:0>that boy Sasan used to make
food here before the phenomena began.

I wish the sludge would go away and that
things would return to normal.
talk9014_02:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_00>As soon as she read this, my daughter,
<clr:0000>Finley<clr:ffff>, declared she was "off on an
adventure to find the treasure."
Before he knew what hit him, she had
grabbed <clr:0000>Sasan <clr:ffff>and together they raced
out of the domain!
<sp:3:0:2:0c00><snd:Think_01>Finley is headstrong to say the least.
She'll be fine, but I'm a little worried
about poor Sasan.
<clr:0000>Tarm Point<clr:ffff> is way off to the southeast of
the domain, so it's pretty far...<sp:5:1:0> I hope they
make it there safely.
talk9020_05:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Think_00>I'm glad those two arrived at Tarm Point,
but to think that Finley rushed into the
cave all by herself...
Poor Sasan is probably desperate to find
Finley so they can look for the treasure.
I hope he can manage a raft to catch up.
talk1011:
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:TalkPositive_01>Our bookshelves are chock full of reading
material for the travelers who come
through here.
<sp:3:0:2:0501>These shelves have been neglected for
decades though, so I have no idea what's
even here.
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Ease_00>I really must organize it, but...<sp:5:1:0> *sigh*
It seems like such a pain.
talk1012:
<sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Think_01>It's so quiet!


No one is taking walks because of the
sludge, and we don't get customers
here anymore.
<sp:3:0:2:0001><snd:Ease_00>Is this place going to close, just like that?<sp:5:1:0>
I mean...probably not.
talk1013:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Sad_00>I'm just a little down because customers
have stopped coming by because of
the sludge.<sp:5:1:0>
<sp:3:0:2:0001>I wonder if that sludge will just keep
falling forever...
